alert.note: Alert for Dixie; Taylor (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 14 at 9:29AM EDT until further notice by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... Steinhatchee River near Steinhatchee (US 19) affecting Taylor and Dixie Counties. For the Coastal Big Bend...including Perry (CR 655), Steinhatchee (US 19)...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Steinhatchee River near Steinhatchee (US 19). * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 19.5 feet, Water begins to flood downstream at Steinhatchee Falls Park. Minor flooding of roads begins along River Road NE. Water will begin to encroach onto the yards of residences in the Ancient Oaks Community in Steinhatchee. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM EDT Monday the stage was 20.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 AM EDT Monday was 20.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 19.9 feet this afternoon. - Flood stage is 19.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 21.2 feet on 03/03/1966. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 800 AM EDT.
